stimulusHtml:
A. Compare how the methods of sugarcane production shown in Image 1 and Image 2 reflect the technology of the second agricultural revolution.

B. Explain how the process of globalization contributed to the diffusion of sugarcane from its hearth of domestication.

C. Explain how the type of sugarcane production shown in Image 2 may contribute to air pollution.

D. Explain how womenâ€™s roles in society may be unlikely to change as an area transitions from subsistence farming to commercial farming.

E. Explain how patterns of world trade may affect a developed country that consumes sugar.

features.html:
IMAGE 1: SUGARCANE HARVEST IN KARNATAKA, INDIA

IMAGE 2: SUGARCANE HARVEST IN QUEENSLAND, AUSTRALIA

Source: Pixabay

Sugarcane was originally domesticated in Southeast Asia and is now grown commercially in many parts of the world.
